original: Bamberg, Per Bernhard Konstantin, praktiserande läkare, Göteborg, f. 19/ 4/95 i Gävile av lotskapt. Hjalmar Bernhard Fredrik B.-Hammarberg o. Anna Maria Akerson. G. 29 m. Edith Pettersson. Barn: Karin Anne-Marie f. 32. — Stud :ex. i Gbg 14, med. kand. i Sthlm 22 o. med. Hc. där 27. Res,:-o’ff :vol. 14-16, fänrik i Älvsb. reg. res. 16-18, und:löjtn. där 19-21 o. löjtn. 21- 28, ständ. tjg. v. Älvsb. reg. 14-18, avsk. 28. Tf. stadsläk. i Säter fyra mån. 27, prakt. läk. i Gbg sed. 27, järnv :läk. v. S. Dalarnas Järnv. 27, tf. järnv :läk. v. linj. Gbg-Nordre älv 29, rådgiv, läk. f. Sv:es redarefören, sed. 30, chefsläk. f. Ömsesid. Försäkr:-bol. Protection o. Indemnity sed. 45, förtroendeläk. f. Sjöbefälets Pens:-kassa sed. 44.
translated: Bamberg, Per Bernhard Konstantin, practicing physician, Gothenburg, born April 19, 1895 in Gävile as the son of pilot captain Hjalmar Bernhard Fredrik B.-Hammarberg and Anna Maria Akerson. Married in 1929 to Edith Pettersson with one child, Karin Anne-Marie born in 1932. He completed his student exams in Gothenburg in 1914 and obtained his medical degree in Stockholm in 1922 and medical licentiate there in 1927. He was a reserve officer from 1914-1928 with the rank of lieutenant and served in the Älvsborg Regiment. He was a temporary city physician in Säter for four months in 1927 and then became a practicing physician in Gothenburg. He served as a railway physician for S. Dalarnas Järnväg in 1927 and as a temporary railway physician for the Gbg-Nordre älv line in 1929. He was a consulting physician for the Swedish Shipowners' Association since 1930 and since 1945 he was the chief physician for the mutual insurance company Protection and Indemnity. He was a trusted physician for the Marine Officers' Pension Fund since 1944.
